import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get authentication token by username"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/users/token/{SiteId}/by-username"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Generates an authentication token for a user identified by their username at a specific site. Used for programmatic authentication in integrations and automated processes.

**Prerequisites**
1. **SiteId** - Use [GET /api/v2.0/users/my/locations](/docs/api/locations/get-current-user-locations-v-2) to list locations. Extract `Items[].SiteId`.
2. **Username** - The login username for the target user
3. Requires appropriate administrative privileges

**Workflow Example**
1. Identify site and user: Have SiteId and target Username
2. Request token: POST this endpoint with Username in body
3. Use returned token for subsequent API calls

**Minimal Required Fields**: Username (in request body)

**Use Cases**:
- SSO integration token generation
- Service account authentication for integrations
- Impersonation for support troubleshooting
- Automated process authentication

**Notes**: Requires elevated privileges. Token validity period depends on site configuration. Use HTTPS only. Audit logging captures token generation. For UserId-based token generation, see [POST /api/v1.0/users/token/\{SiteId\}/by-userid/\{UserId\}](/docs/api/users/get-auth-token-by-user-id).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"SiteId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"UUID of the site","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"required":true,"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"string","description":"Username to authenticate","title":"GetAuthTokenByUsernameUsersTokenBySiteIdByUsernameRequest"}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
